Ladies and gentlemen, a new announcement.
The international energy agency IAA
said last year methane emissions
from the global fossil fuel industry
rose to near
record levels, affecting the IEA's overall goal of
combating climate change.  In
exploitation and burning of fossil fuels will release
nearly 120 million tons of methane, a slight increase compared
to 2022 and close to the record level in
2019. This is the third consecutive year that
global methane emissions have increased by
one percent.  Research by the
United Nations liy environmental program also shows that
methane accounts for about 30% of the gas
causing global warming. Currently,
about 40% of methane gas is released
from natural sources, mainly
wetlands.  While human activities
account for the rest, the IEA also
said that around 40 million more
emissions recorded last year
could have been avoided at no additional cost
by using tested methods.  The
IEA hopes that this year there will
be a breakthrough if countries and
fossil fuel companies turn their
commitments to reduce pollution into
concrete actions
for the elderly with Parkinson's disease.
trouble for them to help
these patients become more optimistic. A
research team at the University of London
has launched a project to help turn
these haunting vibrating scales into a
musical project.  The project is carried out by the Welcome Center of
London University, a unit
specializing in the field of neurology. Through
image data in this project, the
attacks of people with Parkinson's disease will
be recorded as waves later.
This information will be sent to
a music production company in the
city of Berlin, Germany, where the songwriting team
will rely on the ups and downs of
the patient's nerve waves to create new songs, which they
will also be based on.  patients' stories
to write appropriate lyrics. The
harmony between the melody and the
patients' stories is very subtle,
thereby having a positive and strong impact on
them. These songs help me have a
different perspective on  The tremors are no
longer scary but very interesting. Thanks to that, I
feel more comfortable when facing the
tremors. A total of four patients
participated in this project and the songs were
composed based on the tremors.  Their work has been
compiled into an album called
primers versus tram. This album has now
been released on digital music platforms
and in vinyl form.

ban in this country, the bill will continue to
